awd_titl_txt: SBIR Phase I:  Process for Producing Steel using Super-Pure Iron Ore Powder (SPIOP) and Hydrogen
awd_abstract_narration:
The broader impact of this Small Business Innovation Research (SBIR) Phase I project is to enable an environmentally sustainable, reduced-carbon emissions steelmaking process for the iron and steel industry.  This industry is responsible for 7%~9% of global carbon emissions. The proposed innovation will produce no solid waste discharge and no greenhouse gas emissions. Furthermore, the proposed innovation will contribute to the United States and society by reducing the use of precious mineral resources and promoting the use of renewable energy sources. Once this innovation is proved to be successful and scalable, it can be commercialized and massively applied to the American iron and steelmaking industry, with the potential to reduce dependency on steel imports, provide greater resilience to the US manufacturing sector, and reduce the carbon footprint.

This SBIR Phase I project will demonstrate the feasibility of producing reduced-carbon emissions steel using Super-Pure Iron Ore Powder (SPIOP) and hydrogen. Steel is ubiquitous in our lives, from bridges and skyscrapers to cars and consumer goods. Yet, producing steel often comes with a long flow sheet, high cost, waste, and pollution. The proposed innovative process uses hydrogen (H2) to directly reduce SPIOP in a high-temperature hydrogen reduction electric furnace to produce steel. The raw iron ore is first ground to a fine target size range (~0-0.076mm) to dissociate iron ore particles from gangue/impure particles such as quartz and rocks. The dissociated iron ore particles are then purified using the company’s high-intensity iron separation technologies. The purified iron ore concentrate is >99.0% purity. The hydrogen reduction process and direct reduced iron melting process occur in the same furnace, producing a one-step crude steel manufacturing process.

This award reflects NSF's statutory mission and has been deemed worthy of support through evaluation using the Foundation's intellectual merit and broader impacts review criteria.

por.por_cntn:
Project Outcomes Report

In our Phase I performance period, American Magnet Company, LLC team has successfully developed an innovative steel production process using super-pure iron ore powder (SPIOP) and hydrogen. This novel method significantly reduces carbon dioxide emissions, addressing the iron and steel industry's contribution to global emissions, currently about 10%. The process eliminates the need for fossil carbon and coke, replacing them with hydrogen to reduce iron ore in a high-temperature furnace. This yields Direct Reduced Iron (DRI) with very low levels of sulfur and phosphorus, which can be further processed into high-quality steel.

The SPIOP-Hydrogen process involves pre-treating iron ore concentrates to remove impurities before reduction. Hydrogen is then used to convert the purified iron ore powder into DRI, which can be melted by electricity in the same or a separate furnace. Carbon can be introduced to produce low-carbon steel, with the liquid iron/steel ready for further processing in refining furnaces or continuous casting. This method simplifies the traditional steelmaking process, eliminating steps like coke production, iron ore pelletizing/sintering, blast furnace reduction, and basic oxygen furnace refinement.

This new steelmaking approach generates zero or near-zero carbon dioxide emissions, offering a more environmentally friendly and cost-competitive alternative. The SPIOP-Hydrogen process enhances energy efficiency and streamlines production, reducing the industry's carbon footprint while maintaining economic viability. Using super-pure iron ore powder and hydrogen, it outputs iron/steel and water, providing a sustainable solution for steel production. Beyond environmental benefits, this process can help revitalize the US manufacturing industry by creating local jobs and reducing reliance on imported steel. Leveraging domestic iron ore and renewable energy, our process supports the economy and contributes to a sustainable industrial future.
